channel.title: Virus - need some help(solved days ago)
channel.description: Not many sites are working I get redirected - I was able to download avast and microsoft security essentials but there anti shields all shut down microsoft essentials says "update" computer at risk i click update it says failed connecting to network. all the scanners i had run shut down i cant even do a boot up scan. i cant contact any customer support anywhere because any site that says "anti virus" or "spy ware" gets redirected to "jump" whatever the hell that is

item.title: Virus - need some help(solved days ago)

item.description:
@emtrescue wrote:

CCleaner does shit you have better luck cleaning it for yourself – do some research of where you go to clean your temp files and registerys run Ccleaner, than look at those places it does shit. This was solved days ago. I simply did a factory recovery in the end.

item.title: Virus - need some help(solved days ago)
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

What I usually do, because my sister is always getting viruses, is first check for the process/program that is causing the problem, locate the files location and erase it from the startup programs, processes, C:/ drive and registry.

Try showing hidden files, as it will most likely be hidden.

You can also almost always tell (with some competence) tell what should and should not be in certain folders.

One last thing, go to WINDOWS > Prefetch and delete all the contents of that folder. The prefetch folder is where the computer stores all the preloaded application’s .dll’s, for faster loading the next time you run it.

Read full topic
item.source: Virus - need some help(solved days ago)

@badger41 wrote:

go to msconfig and untick all programs in the startup tab and restart your computer and then try to scan your computer from there
